meanings.definition: To surpass in wishing or desire.
meanings.sent1: She outwished her friend for the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: He always outwished his siblings when it came to choosing a movie.
meanings.sent3: The cat outwished the dog for the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The student outwished the teacher for a longer summer break.
meanings.sent5: The little girl outwished everyone for the biggest balloon at the fair.

meanings.definition: To have a greater wish or desire than someone else.
meanings.sent1: My brother outwished me for the new toy.
meanings.sent2: The young boy outwished his friends for the chance to ride the pony first.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outwished the birds for the last nut in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The bride outwished the groom for a perfect wedding day.
meanings.sent5: The child outwished the parent for a later bedtime.
